channel.title: CVE Feed for Microsoft Corporation -- Microsoft Edge
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Microsoft Corporation -- Microsoft Edge

item.title: CVE-2018-0800|2024-09-17T00:06:29.793Z -- microsoft%20corporation -- microsoft%20edge
item.description: Microsoft Edge in Microsoft Windows 10 1709 allows an attacker to obtain information to further compromise the user's system, due to how the scripting engine handles objects in memory, aka "Scripting Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2018-0767 and CVE-2018-0780.

item.title: CVE-2017-11863|2024-09-17T01:11:11.215Z -- microsoft%20corporation -- microsoft%20edge
item.description: Microsoft Edge in Microsoft Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, 1703, 1709, Windows Server 2016 and Windows Server, version 1709 allows an attacker to trick a user into loading a page containing malicious content, due to how the Edge Content Security Policy (CSP) validates documents, aka "Microsoft Edge Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11872 and CVE-2017-11874.

item.title: CVE-2018-0771|2024-09-17T00:30:57.144Z -- microsoft%20corporation -- microsoft%20edge
item.description: Microsoft Edge in Microsoft Windows 10 1607, 1703, and Windows Server 2016 allows a security feature bypass, due to how Edge handles different-origin requests, aka "Microsoft Edge Security Feature Bypass".

item.title: CVE-2017-11888|2024-09-17T00:11:14.292Z -- microsoft%20corporation -- microsoft%20edge
item.description: Microsoft Edge in Microsoft Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, 1703, 1709, and Windows Server 2016 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user, due to how Microsoft Edge handles objects in memory, aka "Microsoft Edge Memory Corruption Vulnerability".

item.title: CVE-2018-0876|2024-09-17T00:46:15.022Z -- microsoft%20corporation -- microsoft%20edge
item.description: Microsoft Edge in Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, 1703, 1709, and Windows Server 2016 allows remote code execution, due to how the scripting engine handles objects in memory, aka "Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2018-0889, CVE-2018-0893, CVE-2018-0925, and CVE-2018-0935.

item.title: CVE-2017-8723|2024-09-17T01:16:29.233Z -- microsoft%20corporation -- microsoft%20edge
item.description: Microsoft Edge in Microsoft Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, 1703, and Windows Server 2016 allows an attacker to trick a user into loading a page containing malicious content, due to the way that the Edge Content Security Policy (CSP) validates certain specially crafted documents, aka "Microsoft Edge Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-8754.
